Package ohos.security.fileprotect

Interface ISfpPolicyManager


  • public interface ISfpPolicyManager
    Provides methods for setting and obtaining the label and flag for a file.
    Since:
    5
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Security#DATACLASSFICATION_DATAFLAG

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getFlag​(Context context, String filePath, String labelName)
      Obtains the label flag of a specified file.
      String getLabel​(Context context, String filePath, String labelName)
      Obtains the label of a specified file.
      int setLabel​(Context context, String filePath, String labelName, String labelValue, int flag)
      Sets a specified label for the given file to improve data security and privacy.

    • Method Detail

      • setLabel

        int setLabel​(Context context,
             String filePath,
             String labelName,
             String labelValue,
             int flag)
        Sets a specified label for the given file to improve data security and privacy.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context, from which you can obtain the file storage path and check whether it is a Credential Encrypted (CE) or Device Encrypted (DE) storage path.
        filePath - Indicates the absolute path of the file.
        labelName - Indicates the label name, which can only be SfpPolicyManager#LABEL_NAME_SECURITY_LEVEL currently.
        labelValue - Indicates the label value, which can be S0, S1, S2, S3, or S4.
        flag - Indicates the flag of the label value. The flag can be either of the following if labelValue is S3, and the flag can only be 0x0000 if labelValue is S0, S1, S2, or S4):
        • 0x0000: When the device is locked, the file cannot be opened, read, or written.
        • 0x0001: When the device is locked, the file can be read or written if it is opened, but cannot be read or written if it has been closed, unless the device is unlocked.
        Returns:
        Returns one of the following values:
        • 0: The label is set successfully.
        • 1: Any input parameter is invalid.
        • 2: A label has been set for this file.
        • 3: labelValue does not match the storage type in the application context.
        • 4: This method fails to be called.
        Since:
        5

      • getLabel

        String getLabel​(Context context,
                String filePath,
                String labelName)
        Obtains the label of a specified file.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context, from which you can obtain the file storage path and check whether it is a CE or DE storage path.
        filePath - Indicates the absolute path of the file.
        labelName - Indicates the label name, which can only be SfpPolicyManager#LABEL_NAME_SECURITY_LEVEL currently.
        Returns:
        Returns an empty string if the label fails to be obtained; returns one of the following label values otherwise:
        • "S0"
        • "S1"
        • "S2"
        • "S3"
        • "S4"
        Since:
        5

      • getFlag

        int getFlag​(Context context,
            String filePath,
            String labelName)
        Obtains the label flag of a specified file.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context, from which you can obtain the file storage path and check whether it is a CE or DE storage path.
        filePath - Indicates the absolute path of the file.
        labelName - Indicates the label name, which can only be SfpPolicyManager#LABEL_NAME_SECURITY_LEVEL.
        Returns:
        Returns one of the following label flags:
        • -1: No label has been set for this file.
        • 0: When the device is locked, the file cannot be opened, read, or written. This flag is available when labelValue is S0, S1, S2, S3, or S4.
        • 1: When the device is locked, the file can be read or written if it is opened, but cannot be read or written if it has been closed, unless the device is unlocked. This flag is available only when labelValue is S3.
        Since:
        5
